reviews.text: We visited the "Borri" with friends and had a fantastic meal and some great beers in a traditional pub overlooking the river. All the food was home made, with great attention to detail. The rack of ribs were massive and tender, the steak and Stilton pie tasted wonderful and the cod and chips was delicious. There was a big selection of beers and ciders and the atmosphere was relaxed and very friendly.
reviews.title: “Wow fantastic food and beer in a great location”

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed over in December as I was performing in Plymouth. The pub itself is lovely and the beers even lovelier. Barry was a great host and I enjoyed a convivial afternoon.
reviews.title: Not stayed, just eaten and drunk.

reviews.text: My room was spotlessly clean and a world away from the off the shelf chain hotels I often find myself in.
reviews.title: Quaint village pub B&B, but quite basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though not ensuite It was a pleasure going to sleep and waking up in such a delightful location. I don't have breakfast but Barry did offer to do me a packed brunch.
reviews.title: Great place to stay just outside Plymouth

reviews.text: Stayed here with a group of divers. The rooms are basic but clean and nice and cosy (very important when you've been diving all day!!). The pub is lovely - very friendly, cosy atmosphere and the food is great (and plentiful). Breakfast is also generously sized with a selection of cereals and cooked breakfast made to order. The pub is based 10 mins walk from the Mountbatten centre and there are some pubs and restaurants nearby - although personally I think you'd find it hard to beat the home cooked fayre and portion sizes of the Boringdon, so we stayed put. Enjoyed our stay here, thanks.
reviews.title: Warm, cosy and very well fed!!

reviews.text: Stayed here a couple of times whilst diving with a group. Rooms are basic and clean but looking a little tired. Breakfast is good but the ubiquitous industrial sausage could be bettered.
reviews.title: You won't starve!

reviews.text: The pub is great. A wide selection of well kept ales, wide food menu with hearty portions and usually 3 or four curries as well.
reviews.title: Great hosts
Good food good beer great atmosphere

reviews.text: Good value for money. Barry and Liz are excellent hosts, so friendly and make you feel part of their family. Food was excellent. Fantastically relaxed atmosphere. Great view of the harbour from our room. Definitely recommended. Thanks go to their son who loaned me his iphone charger every night.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant stay

reviews.text: Great budget pub to stay at. Breakfast in the morning was excellent and very filling.
reviews.title: Great Budget B&B
